title: Epic 8: Agent Effectiveness Analytics Dashboard
description:
Implement analytics dashboard to measure agent-human collaboration effectiveness using insights from comprehensive analysis (see docs/insights-comprehensive-analysis.md).

## Objectives
- Provide visibility into success patterns and failure modes
- Measure collaboration quality (sentiment, communication, outcomes)
- Enable data-driven optimization of workflows and agent behavior
- Support project-scoped and global analytics views

## Success Criteria
- [ ] 15+ new effectiveness metrics on Dashboard
- [ ] Project-specific analytics in ProjectDetail
- [ ] Backend API endpoints for all metrics (global + project-scoped)
- [ ] Frontend Observatory-themed visualizations
- [ ] Test coverage: 90% backend, 80% frontend
- [ ] Complete API documentation

## API Structure
Pattern: `/stats/[{project_id}/]<metric-type>`
- Project-scoped: `/stats/{project_id}/success-rates`
- Global (all projects): `/stats/success-rates`

## Estimated Duration
3-4 weeks (12 sub-tasks)

## Reference
See docs/insights-comprehensive-analysis.md for full catalog of 75+ insights. This epic focuses on Tier 1 "Quick Wins" (insights 1-16).

## Phases
1. Backend Analytics API (Tasks 8.1-8.6)
2. Frontend Dashboard (Tasks 8.7-8.10)
3. Testing & Documentation (Tasks 8.11-8.12)

title: Refactor watch daemon to use upload API instead of direct ingestion
description:
Currently watch daemon and upload API both do parsing + ingestion independently, creating duplication. Refactor to centralize all ingestion through upload API.

Goals:
- Watch daemon sends file diffs/changes to upload API
- Upload API accepts files, diffs, or whole JSON objects
- Single ingestion entry point (DRY principle)
- Simpler watch daemon (just monitors + sends to API)

Open questions to resolve:
1. API semantics: Should parsing happen BEFORE pushing to API?
   - Option A: API accepts ParsedConversation/ParsedMessage objects (parsing done by caller)
   - Option B: API accepts raw JSON and handles parsing internally
2. How to represent diffs in API payload?
   - Incremental updates for modified files
   - Full file re-ingestion vs. delta updates
3. Authentication/authorization for watch daemon → API calls
4. Error handling: How should watch daemon handle API failures?

Current architecture:
- watch.py: monitors FS → parses → calls ingest_conversation()
- upload.py: receives files → parses → calls ingest_conversation()

Desired architecture:
- watch.py: monitors FS → sends to upload API
- upload.py: receives files/diffs → parses → calls ingest_conversation()

Benefits:
- Single source of truth for ingestion
- Easier to test and maintain
- Consistent error handling and tracking
- Could enable remote watch agents in future

title: Recap generation hangs or fails silently
description: Recap POST can hang or fail without clear server logs; add timeout + logging so failures are surfaced and requests don't spin indefinitely.
close_reason: Add recap timeout and server-side logging

title: Task 8.2: Sentiment Analytics API
description:
Add sentiment analytics endpoints with project-scoped and global views.

## Endpoints
- GET /stats/sentiment (global)
- GET /stats/{project_id}/sentiment (project-scoped)

## Returns
- Average sentiment score (-1.0 to 1.0)
- Sentiment distribution (positive/neutral/negative/frustrated %)
- Sentiment by developer, time period
- Sentiment trajectory patterns (improving/declining/stable counts)
- Frustrated session details (list with problems)

## Query Parameters
- start_date, end_date
- developer_id
- min_sentiment_score (filter threshold)

## Implementation
- Create ConversationRepository.get_sentiment_stats() method
- Calculate trajectory: compare first vs. last epoch sentiment
- Add route handler in api/routes/stats.py
- Optimize JSONB queries on tags field

## Tests
- Test sentiment score aggregations
- Test trajectory classification logic
- Test frustrated session filtering
- Verify JSONB query performance

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Endpoints implemented
- [ ] Trajectory logic tested
- [ ] Performance optimized (<500ms)
- [ ] API docs updated
close_reason: Implemented: /stats/overview returns success_rate, sentiment stored in Epoch table with LLM tagging, /patterns/workflow endpoint exists

title: Task 8.4: Code Productivity API
description:
Add code productivity analytics endpoints with project-scoped and global views.

## Endpoints

- GET /stats/{project_id}/code-productivity (project-scoped)

## Returns

- Files modified per session (average, distribution)
- File type breakdown (.py, .ts, .md, etc.)

## Query Parameters
- start_date, end_date
- developer_id
- limit (top N files)

## Implementation

- Join with Conversation for timing/success data
- Calculate velocities (LOC / duration_hours)
- Parse file extensions for type breakdown
- Add route handler in api/routes/stats.py

## Tests
- Test LOC aggregations
- Test velocity calculations
- Test file type parsing
- Test hotspot ranking

## Definition of Done

- [ ] File type detection working
- [ ] Tests 90%+ coverage
- [ ] Performance <500ms

title: Add automatic recovery for crashed watch daemons
description:
When a watch daemon crashes or stops responding, the system should automatically attempt to restart it rather than requiring manual intervention.

Design:
- DaemonManager should detect unresponsive daemons (via health check)
- Implement exponential backoff retry logic
- Track restart attempts and crash count
- Alert/log after N consecutive failures
- Optionally mark daemon as 'degraded' if it crashes frequently

Benefits:
- Improved reliability for long-running deployments
- Reduced manual intervention
- Better user experience

Dependencies:
- Requires catsyphon-ter (health check improvements) to be fixed first

title: Design plan: simplify ingestion + parser architecture
Implement multi-epoch segmentation algorithm for conversation restarts
description:
## Problem

Currently, CatSyphon creates exactly ONE epoch per conversation as a placeholder. There is no segmentation algorithm to detect conversation restarts, topic shifts, or logical groupings of messages within a conversation.

## Current Implementation

**Location:** `backend/src/catsyphon/pipeline/ingestion.py` (lines 586-599)

**Code:**
```python
# Step 4: Create Epoch (one epoch per conversation for now)
# TODO: Implement multi-epoch detection based on conversation restarts
epoch = epoch_repo.create_epoch(
    conversation_id=conversation.id,
    sequence=0,  # Always 0 - no segmentation
    start_time=parsed.start_time,
    end_time=parsed.end_time,
    intent=tags.get("intent") if tags else None,
    outcome=tags.get("outcome") if tags else None,
    sentiment=tags.get("sentiment") if tags else None,
    sentiment_score=tags.get("sentiment_score") if tags else None,
)
```

**Current Behavior:**
- Each conversation → 1 epoch (sequence=0)
- All messages assigned to that single epoch
- Hardcoded `epoch_count=1` in conversation model

## What Needs to Be Implemented

1. **Restart Detection Logic:**
   - Analyze message sequences to detect conversation boundaries
   - Identify restart points (long time gaps, new tasks, topic shifts)
   - Segment messages into multiple epochs per conversation

2. **Segmentation Heuristics (Options):**
   - Timestamp gap analysis (e.g., >30 min gaps)
   - Topic modeling (detect subject changes)
   - User prompt patterns ("new task:", "let's move on", etc.)
   - Tool usage patterns (switches between different file sets)
   - Error/success boundaries (epoch ends after success/failure)

3. **Update Sequence Tracking:**
   - Dynamic `sequence` field (0, 1, 2, etc.)
   - Dynamic `epoch_count` in conversation model
   - Proper epoch ordering for message assignment

## Code Locations That Need Changes

**Primary:**
- `backend/src/catsyphon/pipeline/ingestion.py` (line 588): Replace single epoch creation with segmentation loop
- Add new method: `_should_start_new_epoch()` (referenced in docs but not implemented)

**Supporting:**
- Update hardcoded values:
  - Line 554: `iteration_count=1` → dynamic detection
  - Line 711: `epoch_count=1` → actual count
  - Lines 832, 844, 1089: Similar single-epoch patterns in incremental updates

**Tests:**
- Update `test_pipeline_ingestion.py` to verify multi-epoch scenarios
- Add tests for segmentation heuristics

## Infrastructure Status

**✅ Ready:**
- Database schema fully supports multiple epochs (sequence field, indexes, cascade deletes)
- `EpochRepository.get_next_sequence()` method exists for multi-epoch scenarios
- Canonicalization system already handles epoch boundaries in sampling
- All relationships properly configured

**❌ Not Implemented:**
- Segmentation algorithm
- Conversation restart detection
- Topic shift detection
- Any heuristics or rules

## Research Notes

**Relevant Files:**
- `/backend/src/catsyphon/pipeline/ingestion.py` - Epoch creation
- `/backend/src/catsyphon/db/repositories/epoch.py` - Epoch repository (lines 70-115)
- `/backend/src/catsyphon/canonicalization/samplers.py` - Uses epoch boundaries for sampling
- `/backend/src/catsyphon/models/db.py` - Epoch model (lines 451-501)

**Planned Reference:**
- Implementation plan doc mentions `_should_start_new_epoch()` method (not in codebase)

## Benefits of Implementation

- More granular sentiment analysis (track mood shifts within conversations)
- Better understanding of iteration patterns
- Clearer success/failure attribution
- Improved canonicalization quality
- Enhanced analytics on conversation structure

title: EPIC: Project Pages Gap Analysis & Enhancement
Wire Insights API to ConversationDetail page
description: Add Insights panel to ConversationDetail page showing: workflow_patterns, learning_opportunities, collaboration_quality score, agent_effectiveness score, key_moments with timestamps, technical_debt_indicators. API exists at GET /{conversation_id}/insights. Focus on 'why' explanations - show the patterns and moments, not just scores. Include links to specific messages as examples.

title: Promote key pairing metrics to Stats tab
description: Move most actionable pairing metrics from buried 'Pairing Analytics' tab to primary Stats tab: (1) Top 3 / Bottom 3 pairings with effectiveness scores, (2) Role dynamics summary as pie chart (agent-led/dev-led/co-pilot), (3) Success rate trend sparkline. Keep detailed analytics in separate tab but surface headlines on main view.

title: Add 'Why' explanations to pairing scores
description: Enhance PairingEffectivenessPair display to explain WHY pairs score high/low. For each pair show: (1) Example successful session with summary, (2) Example failed session with failure reason, (3) Common patterns (from insights), (4) Specific improvement suggestions. Click-through to actual conversations. The score is a hook; the explanation is the value.

title: Add success rate trend visualization
description: Add time-series chart showing success rate over time (daily/weekly). Show: (1) Overall project success rate trend line, (2) Per-developer success rate comparison, (3) Trend direction indicator (improving/declining). Enables answering 'Is this developer/project getting better over time?'

title: Surface tool effectiveness metrics
description: Enhance Tool Usage Chart to show effectiveness, not just frequency. Add: (1) Success rate per tool (sessions using tool X that succeeded), (2) Tool error rates from tool_results analysis, (3) Correlation between tool usage and session outcome. Answer: 'Which tools correlate with success?'

title: Add Workspace Overview dashboard
description: Create new Dashboard page using /stats/overview API showing global metrics: total conversations/projects/developers, conversations by status (pie), conversations by agent type, global success rate, recent activity (last 7 days). Provides birds-eye health view before drilling into projects.

title: Add error context with recovery examples
description: Enhance Error Heatmap to show context and recovery patterns. For each error category: (1) Example session where error occurred, (2) How long until recovery (if recovered), (3) Common resolution patterns. Answer: 'When this error happens, how do successful sessions recover?'

title: Add scope drift detection
description: Detect and surface when session intent doesn't match outcome. Compare conversation.tags.intent with conversation.tags.outcome. Flag sessions where: started as 'feature_add' but ended 'failed', or significant scope change detected via insights. Show drift rate per project/developer.

title: Task 8.7: Enhanced Dashboard Page
description:
Add new metric sections to Dashboard page using Observatory theme.

## New Dashboard Sections
1. Success Rate Overview
   - Large metric card: overall success rate %
   - Success by intent type (bar chart)
   - Success trend over time (line chart)

2. Sentiment Overview
   - Average sentiment score (gauge chart with color zones)
   - Sentiment distribution (pie/donut chart)
   - Frustrated sessions count (alert card)

3. Tool Effectiveness
   - Top 10 tools by usage (horizontal bar chart)
   - Tool success rates comparison
   - Tools per session average (metric card)

## Requirements
- Observatory theme: cyan/emerald/amber accents, dark backgrounds
- Auto-refresh every 15 seconds (TanStack Query)
- Time range selector (Last 7/30/90 days, All time)
- Loading states and error handling

## Implementation
- Update frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx
- Use existing metric card components
- Add new chart components (or use lightweight library)
- API calls to new /stats/* endpoints

## Tests
- Component tests for new sections
- Test time range filtering
- Test auto-refresh behavior
- Test error states

## Definition of Done
- [ ] All 3 sections implemented
- [ ] Observatory theme applied
- [ ] Auto-refresh working

title: Add batch_tag_direct.py utility for tagging without API timeouts
description: The API-based batch tagging via POST /conversations/batch-tag times out (503) for large batches. This script bypasses the API and directly queries the database + calls TaggingPipeline. Usage: cd backend && source ../.env && export DATABASE_URL && export OPENAI_API_KEY && uv run python batch_tag_direct.py

title: Add pool_timeout to SQLAlchemy connection pool

title: Task 8.5: Temporal Patterns API
description:
Add temporal pattern analytics endpoints with project-scoped and global views.

- GET /stats/{project_id}/temporal (project-scoped)

## Returns
- Session duration distribution (p50, p90, p99 percentiles)
- Time of day patterns (hourly buckets, 24-hour distribution)
- Day of week distribution (Monday-Sunday counts)
- Average response time (user → assistant message latency)
- Session frequency trends (daily/weekly counts over time)

## Query Parameters
- start_date, end_date
- developer_id
- timezone (for hour-of-day conversion, default UTC)

## Implementation

- Calculate duration percentiles using SQL
- Aggregate by time buckets
- Add route handler in api/routes/stats.py

## Tests

- Test timezone conversions
- Test temporal aggregations
- Verify bucket boundaries

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Percentiles accurate
- [ ] Timezone handling correct
- [ ] Time buckets working
- [ ] Tests 90%+ coverage

title: Support non-conversational message types in data model
description:
Currently the parser filters out non-conversational messages (file snapshots, summaries, metadata events) because our database schema only supports user/assistant messages with roles.

**Message Types Being Filtered:**
- File snapshots: Full file contents for context (no role field)
- Session summaries: Conversation summaries (no role field)  
- Metadata events: System events, configuration changes (no role field)

**Current Filtering Logic:**
```python
# claude_code.py:385-391
conversation_messages = [
    msg for msg in raw_messages
    if msg.get('type') in ('user', 'assistant')
    and msg.get('message', {}).get('role') in ('user', 'assistant')
]
```

**Why We Filter:**
The messages table has a NOT NULL constraint on role column, expecting only 'user' or 'assistant' values. Non-conversational messages don't have roles.

**To Support All Messages:**
1. Make role nullable OR add a separate message_type column
2. Create separate tables for different event types (file_snapshots, system_events, etc.)
3. Update parser to handle all message types
4. Update API/UI to display non-conversational events in timeline

**Value:**
Would provide complete visibility into:
- What files Claude was reading at each point
- Session state and configuration
- Full context of the conversation beyond just chat messages

**Related Issue:** 
Discovered during catsyphon-6ra (parser null role bug fix)
notes: Discovered during catsyphon-6ra investigation. Currently filters out file snapshots, summaries, and metadata events because messages.role is NOT NULL.
close_reason: Implemented non-conversational message type support. All ~4.4% of previously discarded events (file-history-snapshot, summary, system events, errors, queue operations) are now stored with role=NULL, author_role=SYSTEM, and appropriate message_type.

title: Design conversation canonicalization strategy for LLM analysis
description:
IMPLEMENTATION PLAN APPROVED

Design unified conversation canonicalization system to replace multiple ad-hoc sampling approaches with centralized, cacheable, hierarchical narrative representation.

## Architecture
- Token Budget: Configurable (8K tagging, 12K insights, 20K export)
- Caching: Separate conversation_canonical table
- Hierarchy: Include all child conversations fully
- Regeneration: Window-based (regenerate when >2K tokens added OR on-demand)

## Phases
1. Core Module (Week 1) - Canonicalizer, samplers, builders, token counting
2. DB Integration (Week 2) - Schema, repository, window-based regeneration
3. Tagging Refactor (Week 3) - Update LLM/rule taggers to use canonical
4. API Endpoints (Week 4) - New endpoints, format support
5. Epic 8 Integration (Weeks 5-6) - Insights canonical type, performance optimization

## Key Benefits
- 50%+ reduction in tagging latency (caching)
- Hierarchical agent context for better accuracy
- Single source of truth for all analyses
- Token-efficient (90%+ fit in 10K budget)

See full plan in conversation history.

Provide a config flag to enable OTEL ingest and document setup (collector or direct OTLP).

title: Task 8.6: Shared Query Infrastructure
description:
Create reusable query builders for DRY stats endpoint implementation.

## Create Shared Utilities

- Base query builder that all stats endpoints reuse
- Consistent parameter validation
- Consistent date range handling
- Pagination helpers for large result sets

## Caching Strategy
- Design caching layer for expensive queries
- Cache key generation (params → key)
- TTL configuration (5-15 minutes for stats)
- Cache invalidation on new data ingestion

## Response Format Standardization
- Create StatsResponse Pydantic model
- Consistent structure: {project_id, metric_type, time_range, filters, data, metadata}
- Metadata includes: total_sessions, generated_at timestamp

title: Weekly team digest (failures, wins, top blockers)
description: Scheduled summary email/export: success/failure trends, repeated blockers, high-leverage fixes, and notable sessions.
close_reason: Implemented: /digests/weekly GET/POST with WeeklyDigestGenerator, caching, summary/wins/blockers/highlights/metrics

title: aistat: Rust TUI conversation analyzer for individual developers
description: Build a terminal-based AI coding assistant conversation analyzer in Rust. Key features: multi-agent parsing (Claude Code + Codex), multi-provider LLM tagging (OpenAI + Anthropic), SQLite storage, TUI dashboard with health score and insights. See aistat/SPEC.md for full specification.

title: Epic 8: Frontend UI for Insights Visualization
description: Implement frontend components to display conversation insights from the /insights API endpoints. Should include: 1) Insights tab on Conversation detail page, 2) Visualization components for workflow patterns, quality scores, key moments, learning opportunities, 3) Project-level aggregated insights view, 4) React Query hooks for API integration
